name: Singapore Green Labelling Scheme
description: The Singapore Green Labelling Scheme (SGLS) was launched in May 1992 to endorse industrial and consumer products that have less undesirable effects on our environment. Administered by the Singapore Environment Council (SEC), the SGLS is the regionâ€™s most established ecolabelling scheme with over 3 000 products certified across 28 countries. The Singapore Green Label acts as a seal of endorsement on the environmentally-friendly claims to prevent the abuse of green-washing. Singapore Green Label certified products have become more marketable and readily accepted by consumers or businesses when making a purchase. Application for the Singapore Green Label is open to both local and foreign companies.
